item.title: How to add items into PI?
item.dc:creator: @omgomgomgl omgomgomgl
item.description:
@omgomgomgl wrote:

case 13345: // dont use that item id use your bronze sword one…
itemDef.modelid = 61721; // put you model id here…
itemDef.name = “Korasi’s Sword”;
itemDef.description = “put you description here.”;
itemDef.modelZoom = ; // replace
itemDef.modelRotationY = ; // replace
itemDef.modelRotationX = ; // replace
itemDef.modelOffset1 = ; //replace
itemDef.modelOffset2 = ; // replace
itemDef.anInt165 = ; // replace
itemDef.anInt200 = ; // replace
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = “Take”;
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
itemDef.itemActions[4] = “Drop”;

after your done show your errors…

o and also this…
if the first one didnt work…

                    itemDef.name = "Korasi's sword";
		itemDef.description = "The sword of a Void Knight.".getBytes();	
		itemDef.actions = new String[5];
		itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield";
		itemDef.modelID = 57784;
		itemDef.maleEquip1 = 57780;
		itemDef.modelZoom = 1400;
		itemDef.modelRotation1 = 700;
		itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60;
		itemDef.modelOffset1 = 25;
		itemDef.modelOffset2 = 60;
		break;

item.title: How to add items into PI?
item.dc:creator: @thekingpin thekingpin
item.description:
@thekingpin wrote:

thank you very much, i will try this after dinner, but ill rep u anyway when i get back :))

EDIT:
Im not sure what u mean about the case number and the model ID number, i just chose a bronze sword ID 1277 and replaces them both with that, im not sure if thats what u meant

also client sides i got this error when i exracted both the folders into the RAW file in my cashe

ItemDef.java:611: cannot find symbol symbol : variable itemActions location: class ItemDef itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; ^ ItemDef.java:614: cannot find symbol symbol : variable modelRotationY location: class ItemDef itemDef.modelRotationY = 267; ^ ItemDef.java:615: cannot find symbol symbol : variable modelRotationX location: class ItemDef itemDef.modelRotationX = 138; ^ ItemDef.java:618: cannot find symbol symbol : variable anInt165 location: class ItemDef itemDef.anInt165 = -1; ^ ItemDef.java:619: cannot find symbol symbol : variable anInt200 location: class ItemDef itemDef.anInt200 = -1; ^ Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 5 errors Press any key to continue . . .

EDIT: to ghet rid of the errors i did this

case 54495: itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.modelID = 54495; itemDef.modelZoom = 848; itemDef.modelRotationY = 280; itemDef.modelRotationX = 0; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 48000;//male wield ModelId itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 48000;//female wield ModelId itemDef.name = "Korasi's Sword"; itemDef.description = "A Sword from Korasi the void knight".getBytes();

and this time it came up with this error

ItemDef.java:610: cannot find symbol symbol : variable itemActions location: class ItemDef itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; ^ ItemDef.java:614: cannot find symbol symbol : variable modelRotationY location: class ItemDef itemDef.modelRotationY = 280; ^ ItemDef.java:615: cannot find symbol symbol : variable modelRotationX location: class ItemDef itemDef.modelRotationX = 0; ^ Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.source: How to add items into PI?

item.title: How to add items into PI?
item.dc:creator: @omgomgomgl omgomgomgl
item.description:
@omgomgomgl wrote:

All right I will very nicely explain this to you.

First, you must take your models the things you downloaded and put them in your raw folder which is located in your cache. Very simple…

Second look for your itemdef.java class.
put the ints which are these

case ####:
itemDef.name = “Korasi’s Sword”;
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.modelID = ###;
itemDef.modelZoom = 848;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 267;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 138;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt165 = -1;
itemDef.anInt200 = -1;
itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
itemDef.description = “#####”.getBytes();
break;

// model id which can be found on what you downloaded is the number like 58156 this number is just a example. but put whatever your number is on the model id area. For the item
description but something like “A Sword from Korasi’s” it could be anything you want.
finally the item id you need to go into your server sided open your item.cfg find some kind of sword you do not like, like a bronze sword and use that item id on the model item id a the top. case ####: that represents the item id.

if you have more question I can help you on this subject of adding new items…

Read full topic
item.source: How to add items into PI?

item.title: How to add items into PI?
item.dc:creator: @thekingpin thekingpin
item.description:
@thekingpin wrote:

Hi all i was just wondering how i could add korasi’s sword to my PI base,

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


thats the model and dat file im using
and i have a guide, but im not sure what it means about the first bit

[code]Now first, get your model and extract it the the RAW folder in your client. Now add this:

case ####:
itemDef.name = “##”;
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.modelID = ###;
itemDef.modelZoom = 848;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 267;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 138;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt165 = -1;
itemDef.anInt200 = -1;
itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
itemDef.description = “#####”.getBytes();
break;

Now, replace the:

= Your model ID you want it to have

= The name of your model

= The number your model had. Like the .dat file that you extracted to your RAW Folder,

it’s title.

= The description of the item when they press examine.

[/code]

do i extract both files to the RAW file or just the one? and where do i add this

case ####:
itemDef.name = "##";
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.modelID = ###;
itemDef.modelZoom = 848;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 267;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 138;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt165 = -1;
itemDef.anInt200 = -1;
itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
itemDef.description = "#####".getBytes();
break;

thanks
